definition: to act blindly without thinking (idiom)
light/easy/gentle/soft/reckless/unimportant/frivolous/small in number/unstressed/neutral/to disparage
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
variant of 舉|举[ju3]
absurd/fantastic/presumptuous/rash
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Never make a move if you are merely optimistic.
sentences.chinese: 如果你只是乐观而已，千万不要轻举妄动。

sentences.english: This is not a trivial matter,don't be indiscretion.
sentences.chinese: 这件事非同小可，不能轻举妄动。

sentences.english: But the Japanese government did not dare to take any further action for fear of reaction from China.
sentences.chinese: 由于顾忌中国的反应，日本政府未敢轻举妄动。

sentences.english: So much of that thing has been done by these reckless Abolitionists.
sentences.chinese: 那些轻举妄动的废奴派做得实在太过份了。

sentences.english: No money and no wise naturally we carefully offend.
sentences.chinese: 没钱又没见识的我们自然小心翼翼不敢轻举妄动。

definition: to rush indiscriminately into action
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
rashly/hastily/without careful consideration
to act recklessly/to mess around
treat sth lightly/to lower one's guard
lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others
to make public/to disclose
to belittle/to look down upon/to despise
to use force/to come to blows
a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
to get involved in/to meddle/interference
to provoke/to tease
to hold back one's troops without moving (idiom); to bide one's time
to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
to be afraid of the consequences/restraining fear
to learn a lesson from the mistakes of one's predecessor (idiom)
